page.title: 12COBBLERS COPPICE, BROMSGROVE
page.content: The Harris Brush Company of Stoke Prior bought most of the 36 acres covered by Cobblers Coppice in 1946. The area was{cleared}and{replanted}in about 1948. The pond indicated on the O.S. map has been filled in, partly by the dumping of refuse. Today, notices warn of the penalty for dumping rubbish. Each {Autumn, }workmen clear out the wood using hand tools and machines, but no {herbicides.}Several {straight tracks }are kept clear to allow {authorised access.}As the wood is well{fenced, }there is no public access and the area is rich in plants and insects. The main trees today are Sycamore, Beech, Silver Birch, Lime, Alder, Ash and Hazel. There are a few conifers and some Holly and Hawthorn seedlings.Bramble,Dogrose,Honeysuckle, nettles, Cleavers, Burdock and Campium are among the most common wild flora.
